metadata.title: CVE-2019-3564 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Go Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages withcontainers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients couldsend short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse,potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects FacebookThrift prior to v2019.03.04.00.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libthrift-0.17.0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-c-glib0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-perl - 0.13.0-2build2
php-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
python3-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
thrift-compiler - 0.13.0-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thrift package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.13.0-2build2').
